clinical_study.official_title: Studying the Impact of a Low Carbohydrate Diet on the Small Intestinal Microbiota

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will recruit probands with a ileo- or colostoma that are otherwise in good general health and analyse the stomal fluids for their microbiota composition. Sampling will be performed over a time span of 28 days, after 14 days probands will modify their base-line diet to a low carbohydrate diet.

detailed_description.textblock:
Additionally to stoma fluids which will be analyzed for their microbiota composition the investigators will also collect skin samples to analyze for microbiota composition and urine to analyze for metabolite composition.
Low carbohydrate diet will allow for consumption of 80g complex carbohydrates per day, simple sugars will have to be avoided completely

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: First phase will be purely observational, second phase involves diet modification

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of microbiota profile by 16S sequencing before and after diet modification for significant differences
primary_outcome.description: Sample content will be measured by 16S sequencing, ecological distances will be assessed by beta-diversity

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative changes of total metabolite abundance in urine
secondary_outcome.description: The whole metabolite composition will be assessed by an untargeted screen done with mass spectrometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of microbiota metabolic potential (microbiome DNA coding for enzymes) after shotgun sequencing
secondary_outcome.description: The total DNA content of the samples will be annotated for for known metabolic active enzymes to assess functionality
The samples will be analysed for the number of bacteria present in them

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of further metagenomic microbiome composition (viral, eucaryotic DNA)
secondary_outcome.description: The DNA of the samples will be screened for parts belonging to viruses or eucaryotic cells

secondary_outcome.measure: Culturing of microbiota if appropriate (in vitro)
secondary_outcome.description: If of interest, culturing of specific bacterial strains will be attempted in vitro with the aim to recreate in vivo observations

arm_group.description: All participants will undergo sample collection during their regular diet and after modification of their diet to a low carbohydrate diet

intervention.description: Participants will reduce their carbohydrate consumption to 80g daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ileostomy or colostomy
- Good general health
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major metabolic diseases that prevent adherence to low carbohydrate diet
- Participation in other clinical trial interfering with study protocol
